intro: Chondrodendron aemulum, commonly known as the "yellow bell" or "yellow star," is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that resemble bells, which bloom in clusters at the ends of its branches. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in cloud forests. Chondrodendron aemulum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some indigenous communities.
